Afghanistan. You will have received my telegram of 5th instant, which was despatched within seven hours of time at which copies of your telegram, of 4th instant were available here. Issue oil such gravity can seldom have been decided more expeditiously. I appreciate Grant's impatience to lose no opportunity to bring his negotiations to successful issue, but you had no alternative but to refer fundamental question of policy for decision of His Majesty's Government, and it" is, in the circumstances, fortunate that they have found themselves able, though not without reluctance, to confirm, the view that you have taken. I emphasise this because Grant appears to under-estimate importance of decision. For his letter is either useless to Afghans or ' else involves permanently that substantial change in our political relations and that repudiation of Afghans of obligations hitherto acknowledged which his Majesty's Government deprecated in paragraph 3 of my telegram of 16th July, and ii could not be taken for granted that they would acquiesce in it....... ,......-
